attributes.action: Indicate publically whether the much vaunted "Court of Public Opinion" achieved the Government's objectives regarding RBS and  whether in that Government's opinion it should also hear the case of MP's Expense Allowance claims
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: £600,000 to police the members' allowances appears an obscene waste of money and a further knee jerk reaction to a Government who has ignored history and has no respect for the Rule of Law. Courting public opinion rather than getting down to the job of Governing only leads one way. The loss of the hard fought rights of all Englishmen (including Scots, Irish and Welsh)

rejection.details: MPs' expenses are a matter for direct communication with Parliament. http://www.parliament.uk
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
